+57%, C++ +71%, Java +54%, JavaScript +83%, Go +56%, Rust +321\%)ÔºåÂú®Python‰∏äËææÂà∞ 35.9\% ÁöÑ Pass@1 ‰∏ÄÊ¨°ÈÄöËøáÁéáÔºåË∂ÖË∂äËßÑÊ®°Êõ¥Â§ßÁöÑ StarCoder-15B„ÄÇ * Â§ßÂπÖÊèêÂçáÔºåÈáèÂåñÂêé‰ªÖÈúÄ6GBÊòæÂ≠òÂç≥ÂèØËøêË°åÔºåÊîØÊåÅËΩªÈáèÁ∫ßÊú¨Âú∞ÂåñÈÉ®ÁΩ≤„ÄÇ * **Êõ¥ÂÖ®Èù¢ÁöÑAIÁºñÁ®ãÂä©Êâã**ÔºöCodeGeeXÊèí‰ª∂Ôºà[VS Code](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=aminer.codegeex), [Jetbrains](https://plugins.jetbrains.com/plugin/20587-codegeex)ÔºâÂêéÁ´ØÂçáÁ∫ßÔºåÊîØÊåÅË∂ÖËøá100ÁßçÁºñÁ®ãËØ≠Ë®ÄÔºåÊñ∞Â¢û‰∏ä‰∏ãÊñáË°•ÂÖ®„ÄÅË∑®Êñá‰ª∂Ë°•ÂÖ®Á≠âÂÆûÁî®ÂäüËÉΩ„ÄÇÁªìÂêà Ask CodeGeeX ‰∫§‰∫íÂºèAIÁºñÁ®ãÂä©ÊâãÔºåÊîØÊåÅ‰∏≠Ëã±ÊñáÂØπËØùËß£ÂÜ≥ÂêÑÁßçÁºñÁ®ãÈóÆÈ¢òÔºåÂåÖÊã¨‰∏î‰∏çÈôê‰∫é‰ª£Á†ÅËß£Èáä„ÄÅ‰ª£Á†ÅÁøªËØë„ÄÅ‰ª£Á†ÅÁ∫†Èîô„ÄÅÊñáÊ°£ÁîüÊàêÁ≠âÔºåÂ∏ÆÂä©Á®ãÂ∫èÂëòÊõ¥È´òÊïàÂºÄÂèë„ÄÇ * **Êõ¥ÂºÄÊîæÁöÑÂçèËÆÆ**ÔºöCodeGeeX2-6B ÊùÉÈáçÂØπÂ≠¶ÊúØÁ†îÁ©∂ÂÆåÂÖ®ÂºÄÊîæÔºåÂ°´ÂÜô[ÁôªËÆ∞Ë°®](https://open.bigmodel.cn/mla/form?mcode=CodeGeeX2-6B)Áî≥ËØ∑ÂïÜ‰∏ö‰ΩøÁî®„ÄÇ ## ‰ΩøÁî®ÊïôÁ®ã * [Âø´ÈÄüÂºÄÂßã](#Âø´ÈÄüÂºÄÂßã) * [Êé®ÁêÜÊïôÁ®ãÔºàÂ§öÂç°Êé®ÁêÜÔºåÂä†ÈÄüÊé®ÁêÜÔºåÂ§öÂπ≥Âè∞Êé®ÁêÜÁ≠âÔºâ](docs/zh/inference_zh.md) ## AIÁºñÁ®ãÂä©Êâã ![](resources/codegeex_demo.png) Êàë‰ª¨ÂºÄÂèë‰∫ÜÊîØÊåÅ VS Code„ÄÅ IntelliJ IDEA„ÄÅPyCharm„ÄÅGoLand„ÄÅWebStorm„ÄÅAndroid Studio Á≠âIDEÁöÑ CodeGeeX Êèí‰ª∂„ÄÇÂú®Êèí‰ª∂‰∏≠ÔºåÂèØ‰ª•Êõ¥Áõ¥Êé•Âú∞‰ΩìÈ™åÂà∞ CodeGeeX2 Ê®°ÂûãÂú®‰ª£Á†ÅÁîüÊàê‰∏éË°•ÂÖ®„ÄÅÊ∑ªÂä†Ê≥®Èáä„ÄÅ‰ª£Á†ÅÁøªËØëÂèäÊäÄÊúØÈóÆÁ≠îÊñπÈù¢ÁöÑËÉΩÂäõ‰∏∫ÂºÄÂèëÊïàÁéáÂ∏¶Êù•ÁöÑÊèêÂçá„ÄÇÊ¨¢ËøéÂú®IDE‰∏≠‰∏ãËΩΩ CodeGeeX Êèí‰ª∂Ëé∑ÂæóÊõ¥Âä†ÂÖ®Èù¢ÁöÑAIÁºñÁ®ã‰ΩìÈ™åÔºåËØ¶ÊÉÖËßÅ[CodeGeeX‰∏ªÈ°µ](https://codegeex.cn/)„ÄÇ ## Âø´ÈÄüÂºÄÂßã ### ‰ΩøÁî®`transformers`Âø´ÈÄüË∞ÉÁî®[CodeGeeX2-6B](https://huggingface.co/THUDM/codegeex2-6b)Ôºö ```python from transformers import AutoTokenizer, AutoModel tokenizer = AutoTokenizer.from_pretrained("THUDM/codegeex2-6b", trust_remote_code=True) model = AutoModel.from_pretrained("THUDM/codegeex2-6b", trust_remote_code=True, device='cuda') model = model.eval() # remember adding a language tag for better performance prompt = "# language: Python\n# write a bubble sort function\n" inputs = tokenizer.encode(prompt, return_tensors="pt").to(model.device) outputs = model.generate(inputs, max_length=256, top_k=1) response = tokenizer.decode(outputs[0]) >>> print(response) # language: Python # write a bubble sort function def bubble_sort(list): for i in range(len(list) - 1): for j in range(len(list) - 1): if list[j] > list[j + 1]: list[j], list[j + 1] = list[j + 1], list[j] return list print(bubble_sort([5, 2, 1, 8, 4])) ``` ### ÂêØÂä® Gradio DEMOÔºö ``` python ./demo/run_demo.py usage: run_demo.py [-h] [--model-path MODEL_PATH] [--example-path EXAMPLE_PATH] [--quantize QUANTIZE] [--chatglm-cpp] [--fastllm] [--n-gpus N_GPUS] [--gpu GPU] [--cpu] [--auth] [--username yourname] [--password yourpassword] [--port PORT] [--listen ADDRESS] # Ëã•Ë¶ÅÂêØÁî®Ë∫´‰ªΩÈ™åËØÅÔºåËØ∑ÂÖàÂêØÁî®--authÔºåÁÑ∂ÂêéÂÆö‰πâ--username‰∏é--passwordÔºåÂ¶ÇÔºö python run_demo.py --auth --username user --password password # Ëã•Ë¶ÅÁõëÂê¨ÊâÄÊúâÂú∞ÂùÄËØ∑ÊåáÂÆö --listen 0.0.0.0 ``` ÊîØÊåÅ‰ΩøÁî® [ChatGLM.cpp](https://github.com/li-plus/chatglm.cpp) ÈáèÂåñÊé®ÁêÜÂä†ÈÄüÔºö ```sh python ./demo/run_demo.py --quantize 4 --chatglm-cpp ``` ### ÂêØÂä®FAST API: ``` python ./demo/fastapicpu.py usage: fastapicpu.py [-h] [--model-path MODEL_PATH] [--listen ADDRESS] [--port PORT] [--workders NUM] [--cpu] [--half] [--quantize QUANTIZE] [--chatglm-cpp] # --cpuÂêØÁî®cpu --halfÂêØÁî®.half() ``` ÊîØÊåÅ‰ΩøÁî® [ChatGLM.cpp](https://github.com/li-plus/chatglm.cpp) ÈáèÂåñÊé®ÁêÜÂä†ÈÄüÔºåÂêåÊ†∑Ê∑ªÂä† `--quantize 4 --chatglm-cpp` ÂèÇÊï∞Âç≥ÂèØ„ÄÇ ### API‰ΩøÁî®Á§∫‰æã ``` curl -X POST "http://127.0.0.1:7860" \ -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \ -d '{"lang": "Python", "prompt": "# Write a quick sort function"}' ``` ‚ùóÔ∏èËØ∑Ê≥®ÊÑèÔºö * CodeGeeX2-6B ÊòØ‰∏Ä‰∏™Âü∫Â∫ß‰ª£Á†ÅÁîüÊàêÊ®°ÂûãÔºå‰∏çÂÖ∑Â§áËÅäÂ§©ËÉΩÂäõ„ÄÇËØ∑ÂâçÂæÄÊèí‰ª∂‰∏≠‰ΩìÈ™åÊõ¥ÂÖ®Èù¢ÁöÑ Ask CodeGeeX ËÅäÂ§©ÂäüËÉΩ„ÄÇ * Âú®‰ΩøÁî® CodeGeeX2-6B ÁöÑË°•ÂÖ®ÂäüËÉΩÊó∂ÔºåËæìÂÖ•promptÈúÄË¶ÅÈÅµÂæ™ÁâπÂÆöÁöÑÊ†ºÂºè‰ª•Ëé∑ÂæóÊúÄÂ•ΩÁöÑÊïàÊûú„ÄÇÊØîÂ¶ÇÈúÄË¶ÅÂú®ÂºÄÂ§¥Âä†ÂÖ•ÁºñÁ®ãËØ≠Ë®ÄÊ†áÁ≠æÔºà`# language: Python`ÔºåËØ∑Êü•Áúã[ÂÆåÊï¥ËØ≠Ë®ÄÂàóË°®](https://github.com/THUDM/CodeGeeX2/blob/main/evaluation/utils.py#L14)ÔºâÔºå‰ª•Ê≥®ÈáäÁöÑÂΩ¢ÂºèÂÜôpromptÁ≠â„ÄÇÂèÇËÄÉ`run_demo.py`‰∏≠ÁöÑÂ§ÑÁêÜ„ÄÇ * Â¶ÇÊûúÊòæÂç°‰∏çÊîØÊåÅ`bfloat16`Ê†ºÂºèÔºåÂ∞Ü‰ºöËæìÂá∫ÈîôËØØÁöÑÂÜÖÂÆπÔºåÈúÄË¶ÅÂ∞ÜÊ®°ÂûãËΩ¨Êç¢Êàê`float16`Ê†ºÂºèÔºö ```python model = AutoModel.from_pretrained("THUDM/codegeex2-6b", trust_remote_code=True).half().cuda() ``` * Â¶ÇÊûúÈúÄË¶Å‰ΩøÁî®Â§öÊòæÂç°Âä†ËΩΩÊ®°Âûã,ÂèØ‰ª•Â∞Ü‰ª•‰∏ã‰ª£Á†ÅÔºö ```python tokenizer = AutoTokenizer.from_pretrained("THUDM/codegeex2-6b", trust_remote_code=True) model = AutoModel.from_pretrained("THUDM/codegeex2-6b", trust_remote_code=True, device='cuda') model = model.eval() ``` ÊõøÊç¢‰∏∫ ```python def get_model(): tokenizer = files.content:
![](resources/codegeex_logo.png)

üè† HomepageÔΩúüõ† Extensions VS Code, JetbrainsÔΩúü§ó HF RepoÔΩúüìÑ Paper

üëã Join our Discord, Slack, Telegram, WeChat

Êü•Áúã[‰∏≠ÊñáÁâà](README.md)
[Êó•Êú¨Ë™û](README_JA.md)„ÅßË™≠„ÇÄ
Lire en [Fran√ßais](README_FR.md) # CodeGeeX2: A More Powerful Multilingual Code Generation Model CodeGeeX2 is the second-generation model of the multilingual code generation model [CodeGeeX](https://github.com/THUDM/CodeGeeX) ([KDD‚Äô23](https://arxiv.org/abs/2303.17568)), which is implemented based on the [ChatGLM2](https://github.com/THUDM/ChatGLM2-6B) architecture trained on more code data. Due to the advantage of ChatGLM2, CodeGeeX2 has been comprehensively improved in coding capability (+107% > CodeGeeX; with only 6B parameters, surpassing larger StarCoder-15B for some tasks). It has the following features: * **More Powerful Coding Capabilities**: Based on the ChatGLM2-6B model, CodeGeeX2-6B has been further pre-trained on 600B code tokens, which has been comprehensively improved in coding capability compared to the first-generation. On the [HumanEval-X](https://huggingface.co/datasets/THUDM/humaneval-x) benchmark, all six languages have been significantly improved (Python +57%, C++ +71%, Java +54%, JavaScript +83%, Go +56%, Rust +321\%), and in Python it reached 35.9% of Pass@1 one-time pass rate, surpassing the larger StarCoder-15B. * **More Useful Features**: Inheriting the ChatGLM2-6B model features, CodeGeeX2-6B better supports both Chinese and English prompts, maximum 8192 sequence length, and the inference speed is significantly improved compared to the first-generation. After quantization, it only needs 6GB of GPU memory for inference, thus supports lightweight local deployment. * **Comprehensive AI Coding Assistant**: The backend of CodeGeeX plugin ([VS Code](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=aminer.codegeex), [Jetbrains](https://plugins.jetbrains.com/plugin/20587-codegeex)) is upgraded, supporting 100+ programming languages, and adding practical functions such as infilling and cross-file completion. Combined with the "Ask CodeGeeX" interactive AI coding assistant, it can be used to solve various programming problems via Chinese or English dialogue, including but not limited to code summarization, code translation, debugging, and comment generation, which helps increasing the efficiency of developpers. * **Open License**: CodeGeeX2-6B weights are fully open to academic research, and please apply for commercial use by filling in the [registration form](https://open.bigmodel.cn/mla/form?mcode=CodeGeeX2-6B). ## AI Coding Assistant ![](resources/codegeex_demo.png) We have developed the CodeGeeX plugin, which supports IDEs such as VS Code, IntelliJ IDEA, PyCharm, GoLand, WebStorm, and Android Studio. The plugin allows you to experience the CodeGeeX2 model's capabilities in code generation and completion, annotation, code translation, and "Ask CodeGeeX" interactive programming, which can help improve your development efficiency. Please download the CodeGeeX plugin in your IDE to get a more comprehensive AI coding experience. You can find more details on our [homepage]( https://codegeex.cn/). ## Get Started Use `transformers` to quickly launch [CodeGeeX2-6B](https://huggingface.co/THUDM/codegeex2-6b)Ôºö ```python from transformers import AutoTokenizer, AutoModel tokenizer = AutoTokenizer.from_pretrained("THUDM/codegeex2-6b", trust_remote_code=True) model = AutoModel.from_pretrained("THUDM/codegeex2-6b", trust_remote_code=True, device='cuda') model = model.eval() # remember adding a language tag for better performance prompt = "# language: Python\n# write a bubble sort function\n" inputs = tokenizer.encode(prompt, return_tensors="pt").to(model.device) outputs = model.generate(inputs, max_length=256, top_k=1) response = tokenizer.decode(outputs[0]) >>> print(response) # language: Python # write a bubble sort function def bubble_sort(list): for i in range(len(list) - 1): for j in range(len(list) - 1): if list[j] > list[j + 1]: list[j], list[j + 1] = list[j + 1], list[j] return list print(bubble_sort([5, 2, 1, 8, 4])) ``` Launch Gradio DEMO: ``` python ./demo/run_demo.py ``` ‚ùóÔ∏èAttention: * CodeGeeX2 is a base model, which is not instruction-tuned for chatting. It can do tasks like code completion/translation/explaination. To try the instruction-tuned version in CodeGeeX plugins ([VS Code](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=aminer.codegeex), [Jetbrains](https://plugins.jetbrains.com/plugin/20587-codegeex)). * Programming languages can be controled by adding `language tag`, e.g., `# language: Python`. The format should be respected to ensure performance, full list can be found [here](https://github.com/THUDM/CodeGeeX2/blob/main/evaluation/utils.py#L14). Please write comments under the format of the selected programming language to achieve better results. * If the GPU doesn't support `bfloat16` format, it will cause incorrect output. Please convert the model to `float16` format: ```python model = AutoModel.from_pretrained("THUDM/codegeex2-6b", trust_remote_code=True).half().cuda() ``` * If you need to use Multiple GPUs to load the model, you can use the following code: ```python tokenizer = AutoTokenizer.from_pretrained("THUDM/codegeex2-6b", trust_remote_code=True) model = AutoModel.from_pretrained("THUDM/codegeex2-6b", trust_remote_code=True, device='cuda') model = model.eval() ``` Replace with ```python def get_model(): tokenizer = AutoTokenizer.from_pretrained("THUDM/codegeex2-6b", trust_remote_code=True) from gpus import load_model_on_gpus # The "gpus" file is located in the demo folder model = load_model_on_gpus("THUDM/codegeex2-6b", num_gpus=2) model = model.eval() return tokenizer, model tokenizer, model = get_model() ``` ## Evaluation CodeGeeX2 is a base model for multilingual code generation, which has been significantly improved in its coding ability compared to the previous generation. The following are the evaluation results on the HumanEval, HumanEval-X, and DS1000 benchmarks (the evaluation metric Pass@k is the same as in the [paper](https://arxiv.org/abs/2303.17568)): ### HumanEval (Pass@1,10,100) | **Model** | **Pass@1** | **Pass@10** | **Pass@100** | | :-----------------: | :--------: | :---------: | :----------: | | CodeGen-16B-multi | 19\.2 | 34\.6 | 55\.2 | | CodeGeeX-13B | 22\.9 | 39\.6 | 60\.9 | | Codex-12B | 28\.8 | 46\.8 | 72\.3 | | CodeT5Plus-16B-mono | 30\.9 | 51\.6 | 76\.7 | | Code-Cushman-001 | 33\.5 | 54\.3 | 77\.4 | | LLaMA-65B | 23\.7 | - | 79\.3 | | LLaMA2-70B | 29\.9 | - | - | | CodeGen2\.5-7B-mono | 33\.4 | 58\.4 | 82\.7 | | StarCoder-15B | 33\.2 | 61\.0 | 84\.7 | | **CodeGeeX2-6B** | **35\.9** | **62\.6** | **88\.3** | > `n=20, t=0.2, top_p=0.95` for **Pass@1**; `n=200, t=0.8, top_p=0.95` for **Pass@10** and **Pass@100**. ### HumanEval-X (Pass@1) | **Model** | **Python** | **C++** | **Java** | **JavaScript** | **Go** | **Rust** | **Overall** | | :------------------: | :--------: | :-------: | :-------: | :------------: | :-------: | :-------: | :---------: | | CodeGen-16B-multi | 19\.2 | 18\.1 | 15\.0 | 18\.4 | 13\.0 | 1\.8 | 14\.2 | | CodeGeeX-13B | 22\.9 | 17\.1 | 20\.0 | 17\.6 | 14\.4 | 4\.3 | 16\.0 | | Replit-code-v1-3B | 22\.0 | 20\.1 | 20\.1 | 20\.1 | 12\.2 | 8\.6 | 17\.2 | | CodeGen2\.5-7B-multi | 30\.6 | 24\.3 | 29\.0 | 27\.5 | 18\.9 | **20\.1** | 25\.1 | | StarCoder-15B | 35\.5 | 28\.2 | **31\.5** | **33\.2** | 21\.3 | 17\.8 | 27\.9 | | **CodeGeeX2-6B** | **35\.9** | **29\.3** | 30\.8 | 32\.2 | **22\.5** | 18\.1 | **28\.1** | > `n=20, t=0.2, top_p=0.95` for **Pass@1**. The above results can be reproduced by running `scripts/run_humanevalx.sh`. Refer to [HumanEval-X environment](https://github.com/THUDM/CodeGeeX/blob/main/codegeex/benchmark/README_zh.md) for the experiment setups. ### DS1000 (Pass@1) | **Model** | **Matplotlib** | **Numpy** | **Pandas** | **Pytorch** | **SciPy** | **Scikit-learn** | **TensorFlow** | **Overall** | | :--------------: | :------------: | :-------: | :--------: | :---------: | :-------: | :--------------: | :------------: | :---------: | | \# Samples | 155 | 220 | 291 | 68 | 106 | 115 | 45 | 1000 | | CodeGen-16B-Mono | 31\.7 | 10\.9 | 3\.4 | 7\.0 | 9\.0 | 10\.8 | 15\.2 | 11\.7 | | code-cushman-001 | 40\.7 | 21\.8 | 7\.9 | 12\.4 | 11\.3 | 18\.0 | 12\.2 | 18\.1 | | Codex-001 | 41\.8 | 26\.6 | 9\.4 | 9\.7 | 15\.0 | 18\.5 | 17\.2 | 20\.2 | | **CodeGeeX2-6B** | 40\.5 | 25\.5 | 14\.5 | 17\.3 | 19\.3 | 24\.0 | 23\.0 | 23\.1 | | StarCoder-15B | 51\.7 | 29\.7 | 11\.4 | 21\.4 | 20\.2 | 29\.5 | 24\.5 | 26\.0 | | Codex-002 | **57\.0** | **43\.1** | **26\.5** | **41\.8** | **31\.8** | **44\.8** | **39\.3** | **39\.2** | > `n=40, t=0.2, top_p=0.5` for **Pass@1**„ÄÇ The above results can be reproduced by the code in [DS1000 repo](https://github.com/HKUNLP/DS-1000.git). ## Inference CodeGeeX2 is more friendly to deployment than the previous generation. Thanks to the use of Multi-Query Attention and Flash Attention, the inference speed is faster, and only 6GB of GPU memory is required after INT4 quantization. ### Quantization | **Model** | FP16/BF16 | INT8 | INT4 | | :--------------: | :-------: | :-----: | :----: | | CodeGeeX-13B | 26\.9 GB | 14\.7 GB | - | | **CodeGeeX2-6B** | 13\.1 GB | 8\.2 GB | 5\.5 GB | > Based on PyTorch 2.0, using `torch.nn.functional.scaled_dot_product_attention` for effecient attention mechanism„ÄÇ ### Acceleration | **Model** | **Inference speed (token/s)** | | :--------------: | :-------------: | | CodeGeeX-13B | 32 | | **CodeGeeX2-6B** | 94 | > `batch_size=1, max_length=2048`, both using acceleration framework, in `GeForce RTX-3090`„ÄÇ ## License The code in this repository is open source under the [Apache-2.0](https://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0) license. The model weights are licensed under the [Model License](MODEL_LICENSE). CodeGeeX2-6B weights are open for academic research, and please apply for commercial use by filling in the [registration form](https://open.bigmodel.cn/mla/form?mcode=CodeGeeX2-6B). ## Citation If you find our work helpful, please feel free to cite the following paper: ``` @inproceedings{zheng2023codegeex, title={CodeGeeX: A Pre-Trained Model for Code Generation with Multilingual Benchmarking on HumanEval-X}, author={Qinkai Zheng and Xiao Xia and Xu Zou and Yuxiao Dong and Shan Wang and Yufei Xue and Zihan Wang and Lei Shen and Andi Wang and Yang Li and Teng Su and Zhilin Yang and Jie Tang}, booktitle={Proceedings of the 29th ACM SIGKDD Conference on Knowledge Discovery and Data Mining}, pages={5673--5684}, year={2023} } ```

Read this in [English](README_EN.md)
[Êó•Êú¨Ë™û](README_JA.md)„ÅßË™≠„ÇÄ # CodeGeeX2: Un Mod√®le de G√©n√©ration de Code Plus Puissant CodeGeeX2 est la deuxi√®me it√©ration du mod√®le de g√©n√©ration de code multilingue [CodeGeeX](https://github.com/THUDM/CodeGeeX) ([KDD‚Äô23](https://arxiv.org/abs/2303.17568)), bas√© sur [ChatGLM2](https://github.com/THUDM/ChatGLM2-6B) et entrain√© sur un large corpus de code. Gr√¢ce √† l'architecture ChatGLM2, CodeGeeX2 excelle sur une multitude de t√¢ches de g√©n√©ration de code (+107% > CodeGeeX; avec seulement 6 milliards de param√®tres, d√©passant StarCoder-15B pour certaines t√¢ches). CodeGeeX2 poss√®de les fonctionnalit√©s suivantes: * **Capacit√©s de G√©n√©ration de Code Accrues**: Bas√© sur ChatGLM2-6B, CodeGeeX2-6B √† √©t√© entrain√© sur un dataset de 600 milliards de tokens de plus ce qui a propuls√© ses capacit√©s de g√©n√©ration de code par rapport √† la g√©n√©ration pr√©c√©dente. Sur [HumanEval-X](https://huggingface.co/datasets/THUDM/humaneval-x), le mod√®le op√®re bien mieux que son pr√©d√©cesseur (Python +57%, C++ +71%, Java +54%, JavaScript +83%, Go +56%, Rust +321\%). En Python, CodeGeeX atteint un score Pass@1 de 35.9%, surpassant StarCoder-15B malgr√© le fait que CodeGeeX ait ~3 fois moins de param√®tres. * **Des Fonctionnalit√©s Plus Utiles**: H√©ritant des fonctionnalit√©s de ChatGLM2-6B, CodeGeeX2-6B prend mieux en charge les prompts en chinois et en anglais, peut ing√©rer jusqu'√† 8192 tokens, et se dotte d'une vitesse de g√©n√©ration en inference fortement accrue compar√© √† la derni√®re g√©n√©ration. Apr√®s quantisation, CodeGeeX fonctionne sur un GPU avec >6GB de m√©moire, permettant un d√©ploiement local efficace. * **Un Assistant Intelligent dans votre √âditeur**: Les plugins ([VS Code](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=aminer.codegeex), et [Jetbrains](https://plugins.jetbrains.com/plugin/20587-codegeex)) ont √©t√© mis √† jour et sont maintenant compatible avec plus de 100 langages de programmation. Le mod√®le, coupl√© √† l'extension, permet d√©sormais aux utilisateurs de g√©n√©rer du code pour plusieurs fichiers ainsi que de g√©n√©rer et modifier des sections de code. CodeGeeX2 est maintenant capable de r√©soudre de nombreux probl√®mes de programmation. Les utilisateurs peuvent profiter de la fonctionnalit√© "Ask CodeGeeX" pour discuter de mani√®re interactive avec un AI-assistant afin de r√©sumer et d'expliquer du code, traduire du code entre langages, rajouter des commentaires, etc. CodeGeeX permet de maximiser la productivit√© de ses utilisateurs. * **License Open-Source**: Les poids du mod√®le CodeGeeX2-6B sont en acc√®s libre pour toute utilisation dans le cadre de la recherche. Pour toute utilisation commerciale, merci de consulter ce [formulaire](https://open.bigmodel.cn/mla/form?mcode=CodeGeeX2-6B). ## Assistant Intelligent ![](resources/codegeex_demo.png) Nous avons d√©velopp√© une extension pour VS Code, IntelliJ IDEA, PyCharm, GoLand, WebStorm, and Android Studio. L'extension permet de profiter des capacit√©s du mod√®le CodeGeeX2 et de g√©n√©rer, annoter et traduire du code. La fonctionnalit√© "Ask CodeGeeX" permet de coder de mani√®re interactive et am√©liore grandement votre productivit√©. T√©l√©chargez l'extension CodeGeeX dans votre IDE pour une meilleure exp√©rience de d√©veloppement. Trouvez plus de d√©tail sur notre [site]( https://codegeex.cn/). ## Utilisation Pour ex√©cuter [CodeGeeX2-6B](https://huggingface.co/THUDM/codegeex2-6b), utilisez la librairie `transformers`Ôºö ```python from transformers import AutoTokenizer, AutoModel tokenizer = AutoTokenizer.from_pretrained("THUDM/codegeex2-6b", trust_remote_code=True) model = AutoModel.from_pretrained("THUDM/codegeex2-6b", trust_remote_code=True, device='cuda') model = model.eval() # TIP: Utilisez un tag pour identifier le langage dans lequel vous souhaitez g√©n√©rer. prompt = "# language: Python\n# write a bubble sort function\n" inputs = tokenizer.encode(prompt, return_tensors="pt").to(model.device) outputs = model.generate(inputs, max_length=256, top_k=1) response = tokenizer.decode(outputs[0]) >>> print(response) # language: Python # write a bubble sort function def bubble_sort(list): for i in range(len(list) - 1): for j in range(len(list) - 1): if list[j] > list[j + 1]: list[j], list[j + 1] = list[j + 1], list[j] return list print(bubble_sort([5, 2, 1, 8, 4])) ``` Acc√©der √† la d√©mo Gradio: ``` python ./demo/run_demo.py ``` ‚ùóÔ∏èAttention: * Cette version de CodeGeeX2 est capable de compl√©ter / expliquer / traduire du code mais n'a pas √©t√© fine-tuned pour √™tre utilis√© comme un chatbot. Pour acc√©der √† la version chatbot de CodeGeeX, utilisez les extensions [VS Code](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=aminer.codegeex) et [Jetbrains](https://plugins.jetbrains.com/plugin/20587-codegeex). * Pour controller le langage dans lequel CodeGeeX2 op√®re, utilisez des tags formatt√©s ainsi: `# language: Python`. La liste de tous les langages de programmations que CodeGeeX supporte est accessible [ici](https://github.com/THUDM/CodeGeeX2/blob/main/evaluation/utils.py#L14). * Si vous avez besoin d'utiliser plusieurs GPU pour charger le mod√®le, vous pouvez utiliser le code suivant: ```python tokenizer = AutoTokenizer.from_pretrained("THUDM/codegeex2-6b", trust_remote_code=True) model = AutoModel.from_pretrained("THUDM/codegeex2-6b", trust_remote_code=True, device='cuda') model = model.eval() ``` Remplacer par ```python def get_model(): tokenizer = AutoTokenizer.from_pretrained("THUDM/codegeex2-6b", trust_remote_code=True) from gpus import load_model_on_gpus # Le fichier "gpus" se trouve dans le dossier de d√©monstration model = load_model_on_gpus("THUDM/codegeex2-6b", num_gpus=2) model = model.eval() return tokenizer, model tokenizer, model = get_model() ``` ## Evaluation CodeGeeX2 est un mod√®le de base capable de g√©n√©rer du code en plusieurs langages de programmation et qui est bien plus performant que la version pr√©c√©dente. Voici les capacit√©s de CodeGeeX sur les benchmarks HumanEval, HumanEval-X, et DS1000 (la m√©trique Pass@k est la m√™me que celle d√©crite dans ce [papier](https://arxiv.org/abs/2303.17568)): ### HumanEval (Pass@1,10,100) | **Model** | **Pass@1** | **Pass@10** | **Pass@100** | | :-----------------: | :--------: | :---------: | :----------: | | CodeGen-16B-multi | 19\.2 | 34\.6 | 55\.2 | | CodeGeeX-13B | 22\.9 | 39\.6 | 60\.9 | | Codex-12B | 28\.8 | 46\.8 | 72\.3 | | CodeT5Plus-16B-mono | 30\.9 | 51\.6 | 76\.7 | | Code-Cushman-001 | 33\.5 | 54\.3 | 77\.4 | | LLaMA-65B | 23\.7 | - | 79\.3 | | LLaMA2-70B | 29\.9 | - | - | | CodeGen2\.5-7B-mono | 33\.4 | 58\.4 | 82\.7 | | StarCoder-15B | 33\.2 | 61\.0 | 84\.7 | | **CodeGeeX2-6B** | **35\.9** | **62\.6** | **88\.3** | > `n=20, t=0.2, top_p=0.95` pour **Pass@1**; `n=200, t=0.8, top_p=0.95` pour **Pass@10** et **Pass@100**. ### HumanEval-X (Pass@1) | **Model** | **Python** | **C++** | **Java** | **JavaScript** | **Go** | **Rust** | **Overall** | | :------------------: | :--------: | :-------: | :-------: | :------------: | :-------: | :-------: | :---------: | | CodeGen-16B-multi | 19\.2 | 18\.1 | 15\.0 | 18\.4 | 13\.0 | 1\.8 | 14\.2 | | CodeGeeX-13B | 22\.9 | 17\.1 | 20\.0 | 17\.6 | 14\.4 | 4\.3 | 16\.0 | | Replit-code-v1-3B | 22\.0 | 20\.1 | 20\.1 | 20\.1 | 12\.2 | 8\.6 | 17\.2 | | CodeGen2\.5-7B-multi | 30\.6 | 24\.3 | 29\.0 | 27\.5 | 18\.9 | **20\.1** | 25\.1 | | StarCoder-15B | 35\.5 | 28\.2 | **31\.5** | **33\.2** | 21\.3 | 17\.8 | 27\.9 | | **CodeGeeX2-6B** | **35\.9** | **29\.3** | 30\.8 | 32\.2 | **22\.5** | 18\.1 | **28\.1** | > `n=20, t=0.2, top_p=0.95` for **Pass@1**. Les r√©sultats ci-dessus peuvent √™tre reproduits avec le script `scripts/run_humanevalx.sh`. Les environements utilis√©s sont renseign√©s [ici](https://github.com/THUDM/CodeGeeX/blob/main/codegeex/benchmark/README_zh.md). ### DS1000 (Pass@1) | **Model** | **Matplotlib** | **Numpy** | **Pandas** | **Pytorch** | **SciPy** | **Scikit-learn** | **TensorFlow** | **Overall** | | :--------------: | :------------: | :-------: | :--------: | :---------: | :-------: | :--------------: | :------------: | :---------: | | \# Samples | 155 | 220 | 291 | 68 | 106 | 115 | 45 | 1000 | | CodeGen-16B-Mono | 31\.7 | 10\.9 | 3\.4 | 7\.0 | 9\.0 | 10\.8 | 15\.2 | 11\.7 | | code-cushman-001 | 40\.7 | 21\.8 | 7\.9 | 12\.4 | 11\.3 | 18\.0 | 12\.2 | 18\.1 | | Codex-001 | 41\.8 | 26\.6 | 9\.4 | 9\.7 | 15\.0 | 18\.5 | 17\.2 | 20\.2 | | **CodeGeeX2-6B** | 40\.5 | 25\.5 | 14\.5 | 17\.3 | 19\.3 | 24\.0 | 23\.0 | 23\.1 | | StarCoder-15B | 51\.7 | 29\.7 | 11\.4 | 21\.4 | 20\.2 | 29\.5 | 24\.5 | 26\.0 | | Codex-002 | **57\.0** | **43\.1** | **26\.5** | **41\.8** | **31\.8** | **44\.8** | **39\.3** | **39\.2** | > `n=40, t=0.2, top_p=0.5` for **Pass@1**„ÄÇ Les r√©sultats ci-dessus peuvent √™tre reproduits avec le code pr√©sent sur le repository [HKUNLP/DS-1000](https://github.com/HKUNLP/DS-1000.git). ## Inference CodeGeeX2 est bien plus simple √† d√©ployer que la g√©n√©ration pr√©c√©dente. L'utilisation de "Multi-Query Attention" et "Flash Attention" acc√©l√®re grandement la vitesse de g√©n√©ration et le mod√®le n'a besoin que de 6GB de m√©moire apr√®s avoir √©t√© quantis√© en INT4. ### Quantisation | **Model** | FP16/BF16 | INT8 | INT4 | | :--------------: | :-------: | :-----: | :----: | | CodeGeeX-13B | 26\.9 GB | 14\.7 GB | - | | **CodeGeeX2-6B** | 13\.1 GB | 8\.2 GB | 5\.5 GB | > R√©sultats obtenus avec PyTorch 2.0, avec `torch.nn.functional.scaled_dot_product_attention` qui est une version plus rapide du calcul de l'attention. ### Accel√©ration | **Model** | **Inference speed (token/s)** | | :--------------: | :-------------: | | CodeGeeX-13B | 32 | | **CodeGeeX2-6B** | 94 | > `batch_size=1, max_length=2048` et en utilisant l'acc√©l√©ration des GPUs `GeForce RTX-3090`„ÄÇ ## License Le code dans ce d√©p√¥t est en libre acc√®s selon les droits et devoirs pr√©vu par la license [Apache-2.0](https://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0). Les poids du mod√®le sont r√©gis par la [license du mod√®le](MODEL_LICENSE). Les poids du mod√®le CodeGeeX2-6B sont en acc√®s libre pour toute utilisation dans le cadre de la recherche. Pour toute utilisation commerciale, merci de consulter ce [formulaire](https://open.bigmodel.cn/mla/form?mcode=CodeGeeX2-6B). ## Citation Si vous trouvez ce projet utile, n'h√©sitez pas √† citer notre papier: ``` @inproceedings{zheng2023codegeex, title={CodeGeeX: A Pre-Trained Model for Code Generation with Multilingual Benchmarking on HumanEval-X}, author={Qinkai Zheng and Xiao Xia and Xu Zou and Yuxiao Dong and Shan Wang and Yufei Xue and Zihan Wang and Lei Shen and Andi Wang and Yang Li and Teng Su and Zhilin Yang and Jie Tang}, booktitle={Proceedings of the 29th ACM SIGKDD Conference on Knowledge Discovery and Data Mining}, pages={5673--5684}, year={2023} } ```

[CodeGeeX](https://github.com/THUDM/CodeGeeX)([KDD'23](https://arxiv.org/abs/2303.17568)) „ÅÆÁ¨¨ 2 ‰∏ñ‰ª£„É¢„Éá„É´„Åß„ÅÇ„Çä„ÄÅ„Çà„ÇäÂ§ö„Åè„ÅÆ„Ç≥„Éº„Éâ„Éá„Éº„Çø„ÅßÂ≠¶Áøí„Åï„Çå„Åü „ÇíÂáåÈßï„Åó„Å¶„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åô)„ÄÇ‰ª•‰∏ã„ÅÆÁâπÂæ¥„Åå„ÅÇ„Çä„Åæ„Åô: * **„Çà„ÇäÂº∑Âäõ„Å™„Ç≥„Éº„Éá„Ç£„É≥„Ç∞Ê©üËÉΩ**: CodeGeeX2-6B „ÅØ„ÄÅChatGLM2-6B „É¢„Éá„É´„Çí„Éô„Éº„Çπ„Å´„ÄÅ„Åï„Çâ„Å´ 600B „ÅÆ„Ç≥„Éº„Éâ„Éà„Éº„ÇØ„É≥„Å´ÂØæ„Åó„Å¶‰∫ãÂâçÂ≠¶Áøí„ÇíË°å„Å£„Å¶„Åä„Çä„ÄÅÁ¨¨‰∏Ä‰∏ñ‰ª£„Å®ÊØîËºÉ„Åó„Å¶„Ç≥„Éº„Éá„Ç£„É≥„Ç∞ËÉΩÂäõ„ÅåÁ∑èÂêàÁöÑ„Å´Âêë‰∏ä„Åó„Å¶„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ[HumanEval-X](https://huggingface.co/datasets/THUDM/humaneval-x) „Éô„É≥„ÉÅ„Éû„Éº„ÇØ„Åß„ÅØ„ÄÅ6 Ë®ÄË™û„Åô„Åπ„Å¶„ÅßÂ§ßÂπÖ„Å™ÊîπÂñÑ„ÅåË¶ã„Çâ„ÇåÔºàPython +57%„ÄÅC++ +71%„ÄÅJava +54%„ÄÅJavaScript +83%„ÄÅGo +56%„ÄÅRust +321%Ôºâ„ÄÅPython „Åß„ÅØ Pass@1 ‰∏ÄÂõûÂêàÊ†ºÁéá 35.9% „Å´ÈÅî„Åó„ÄÅ„Çà„ÇäÂ§ßË¶èÊ®°„Å™ StarCoder-15B „Çí‰∏äÂõû„Çä„Åæ„Åó„Åü„ÄÇ * **„Åù„ÅÆ‰ªñ„ÅÆ‰æøÂà©„Å™Ê©üËÉΩ**: ChatGLM2-6B „É¢„Éá„É´„ÅÆÁâπÂæ¥„ÇíÁ∂ôÊâø„Åó„ÄÅCodeGeeX2-6B „ÅØ‰∏≠ÂõΩË™û„Å®Ëã±Ë™û„ÅÆ„Éó„É≠„É≥„Éó„Éà„ÄÅÊúÄÂ§ß 8192 „Ç∑„Éº„Ç±„É≥„ÇπÈï∑„Çí„Çµ„Éù„Éº„Éà„Åó„ÄÅÊé®Ë´ñÈÄüÂ∫¶„ÅØÁ¨¨‰∏Ä‰∏ñ‰ª£„Å®ÊØîËºÉ„Åó„Å¶Â§ßÂπÖ„Å´ÊîπÂñÑ„Åï„Çå„Å¶„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇÈáèÂ≠êÂåñÂæå„ÄÅÊé®Ë´ñ„Å´ÂøÖË¶Å„Å™ GPU „É°„É¢„É™„ÅØ 6GB „ÅÆ„Åø„Åß„ÄÅËªΩÈáè„Å™„É≠„Éº„Ç´„É´Â±ïÈñã„Çí„Çµ„Éù„Éº„Éà„Åó„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ * **ÂåÖÊã¨ÁöÑ„Å™ AI „Ç≥„Éº„Éá„Ç£„É≥„Ç∞„Ç¢„Ç∑„Çπ„Çø„É≥„Éà**: CodeGeeX „Éó„É©„Ç∞„Ç§„É≥Ôºà[VS Code](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=aminer.codegeex)„ÄÅ[Jetbrains](https://plugins.jetbrains.com/plugin/20587-codegeex)Ôºâ„ÅÆ„Éê„ÉÉ„ÇØ„Ç®„É≥„Éâ„Åå„Ç¢„ÉÉ„Éó„Ç∞„É¨„Éº„Éâ„Åï„Çå„ÄÅ100 ‰ª•‰∏ä„ÅÆ„Éó„É≠„Ç∞„É©„Éü„É≥„Ç∞Ë®ÄË™û„Çí„Çµ„Éù„Éº„Éà„Åó„ÄÅ„Ç§„É≥„Éï„Ç£„É´„ÇÑ„ÇØ„É≠„Çπ„Éï„Ç°„Ç§„É´Ë£úÂÆå„Å™„Å©„ÅÆÂÆüÁî®ÁöÑ„Å™Ê©üËÉΩ„ÅåËøΩÂä†„Åï„Çå„Åæ„Åó„Åü„ÄÇÂØæË©±Âûã AI „Ç≥„Éº„Éá„Ç£„É≥„Ç∞„Ç¢„Ç∑„Çπ„Çø„É≥„Éà "Ask CodeGeeX" „Å®ÁµÑ„ÅøÂêà„Çè„Åõ„Çã„Åì„Å®„Åß„ÄÅ‰∏≠ÂõΩË™û„Åæ„Åü„ÅØËã±Ë™û„ÅÆÂØæË©±„ÇíÈÄö„Åò„Å¶„ÄÅ„Ç≥„Éº„Éâ„ÅÆË¶ÅÁ¥Ñ„ÄÅ„Ç≥„Éº„Éâ„ÅÆÁøªË®≥„ÄÅ„Éá„Éê„ÉÉ„Ç∞„ÄÅ„Ç≥„É°„É≥„ÉàÁîüÊàê„Å™„Å©„ÄÅ„Åï„Åæ„Åñ„Åæ„Å™„Éó„É≠„Ç∞„É©„Éü„É≥„Ç∞ÂïèÈ°å„ÇíËß£Ê±∫„Åô„Çã„Åì„Å®„Åå„Åß„Åç„ÄÅÈñãÁô∫ËÄÖ„ÅÆ‰ΩúÊ•≠ÂäπÁéá„ÇíÈ´ò„ÇÅ„Çã„Åì„Å®„Åå„Åß„Åç„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ * **„Ç™„Éº„Éó„É≥„É©„Ç§„Çª„É≥„Çπ**: CodeGeeX2-6B „Ç¶„Çß„Ç§„Éà„ÅØÂ≠¶Ë°ìÁ†îÁ©∂„Å´ÂÖ®Èù¢ÁöÑ„Å´ÈñãÊîæ„Åó„Å¶„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇÂïÜÁî®Âà©Áî®„Çí„ÅîÂ∏åÊúõ„ÅÆÊñπ„ÅØ„ÄÅ[ÁôªÈå≤„Éï„Ç©„Éº„É†](https://open.bigmodel.cn/mla/form?mcode=CodeGeeX2-6B)„Å´„ÅîË®òÂÖ•„ÅÆ‰∏ä„ÄÅ„ÅäÁî≥„ÅóËæº„Åø„Åè„Å†„Åï„ÅÑ„ÄÇ ## AI „Ç≥„Éº„Éá„Ç£„É≥„Ç∞„Ç¢„Ç∑„Çπ„Çø„É≥„Éà ![](resources/codegeex_demo.png) VS Code„ÄÅIntelliJ IDEA„ÄÅPyCharm„ÄÅGoLand„ÄÅWebStorm„ÄÅAndroid Studio „Å™„Å©„ÅÆ IDE „Çí„Çµ„Éù„Éº„Éà„Åô„Çã CodeGeeX „Éó„É©„Ç∞„Ç§„É≥„ÇíÈñãÁô∫„Åó„Åæ„Åó„Åü„ÄÇ„Åì„ÅÆ„Éó„É©„Ç∞„Ç§„É≥„Çí‰ΩøÁî®„Åô„Çã„Åì„Å®„Åß„ÄÅCodeGeeX2 „É¢„Éá„É´„ÅÆ„Ç≥„Éº„ÉâÁîüÊàê„Å®Ë£úÂÆå„ÄÅ„Ç¢„Éé„ÉÜ„Éº„Ç∑„Éß„É≥„ÄÅ„Ç≥„Éº„ÉâÂ§âÊèõ„ÄÅ"Ask CodeGeeX" ÂØæË©±Âûã„Éó„É≠„Ç∞„É©„Éü„É≥„Ç∞„Å™„Å©„ÅÆÊ©üËÉΩ„Çí‰ΩìÈ®ì„Åô„Çã„Åì„Å®„Åå„Åß„Åç„ÄÅÈñãÁô∫ÂäπÁéá„ÇíÂêë‰∏ä„Åï„Åõ„Çã„Åì„Å®„Åå„Åß„Åç„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ„Çà„ÇäÂåÖÊã¨ÁöÑ„Å™ AI „Ç≥„Éº„Éá„Ç£„É≥„Ç∞‰ΩìÈ®ì„ÇíÂæó„Çã„Åü„ÇÅ„Å´„ÄÅIDE „Å´ CodeGeeX „Éó„É©„Ç∞„Ç§„É≥„Çí„ÉÄ„Ç¶„É≥„É≠„Éº„Éâ„Åó„Å¶„Åè„Å†„Åï„ÅÑ„ÄÇË©≥„Åó„Åè„ÅØ[„Éõ„Éº„É†„Éö„Éº„Ç∏](https://codegeex.cn/)„Çí„ÅîË¶ß„Åè„Å†„Åï„ÅÑ„ÄÇ ## Âßã„ÇÅ„Çã [CodeGeeX2-6B](https://huggingface.co/THUDM/codegeex2-6b) „ÇíÁ¥†Êó©„ÅèËµ∑Âãï„Åô„Çã„Å´„ÅØ„ÄÅ`transformers` „Çí‰ΩøÁî®„Åó„Åæ„ÅôÔºö ```python from transformers import AutoTokenizer, AutoModel tokenizer = AutoTokenizer.from_pretrained("THUDM/codegeex2-6b", trust_remote_code=True) model = AutoModel.from_pretrained("THUDM/codegeex2-6b", trust_remote_code=True, device='cuda') model = model.eval() # remember adding a language tag for better performance prompt = "# language: Python\n# write a bubble sort function\n" inputs = tokenizer.encode(prompt, return_tensors="pt").to(model.device) outputs = model.generate(inputs, max_length=256, top_k=1) response = tokenizer.decode(outputs[0]) >>> print(response) # language: Python # write a bubble sort function def bubble_sort(list): for i in range(len(list) - 1): for j in range(len(list) - 1): if list[j] > list[j + 1]: list[j], list[j + 1] = list[j + 1], list[j] return list print(bubble_sort([5, 2,
